intro: Selinum elatum, commonly known as greater centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and open habitats. The plant features upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in clusters. Its botanical name reflects its historical association with the centaur myth, and it has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments. The plant is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
